column4: CMDR :) pure interest to learn and understand the zeitgeist of our times
Could we install Gnome and KDE both at the same time and not expect any conflicts ?
thought you may only use one at a time
but with both installed, you'll be able to use apps in either from either
: But is there a possiblity of and mishap ?
one package must have the packages it depends on installed
: If someone says there are 14 dependencies for installation is that quite a task to handle ?
not usually, the package manager (dpkg/apt, et al.) handles it
:  OK this is the beauty in Ubuntu I suppose - Am i right and not possibly in the other flavors of linux ?
most other distros use some form of package management too
the Debian system is the ancestor to Ubuntu
don't forget that humans hate change. Anything that isn't familiar is booed.  Case in point:  A former roommate HATED MacOSX after having used my Ubuntu installation for nearly a year
Unity isn't ready for prime time
if you're not willing to do some debugging, you shouldn't use it
THats what is the point probably if you don't know debugging don't use Ubuntu maybe..
